text.name: console_notes
text.text: The Family Computer Disk Systemis a peripheral for Nintendo's Family Computer home video game console, released only in Japan on February 21, 1986. It uses proprietary floppy disks called "Disk Cards" for cheaper data storage and it adds a new high-fidelity sound channel for supporting FDS games. Its name is sometimes shortened as Famicom Disk System or simply Disk System,and abbreviated as FCDS, FDS, or FCD.

text.name: memory
text.text: Memory: 2 KB RAM plus 2 KB video RAM
